reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marv Herzog on May 31, 2008 in Room 308.
reviews.title: Lots of Positives but some Negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is extremely friendly at this hotel. The front desk clerk went out of her way to make sure we had a map and knew about good restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice stay!!

likes.liked: — Neat, new, clean and close to shopping

reviews.title: Bertrand & Ouellette Get-Away
reviews.text: The room was very clean. The balcony has two chairs - adequate for two adults. The bed was clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very noisy. I think they need more soundproofing. The crack under the door is large enough to see peoples feet walking by. You could also hear toilets flushing and people showering.
reviews.title: Thought was a joke, but was really a great place to stay!

likes.liked: — The two free drink coupons for the evening happy hour were a great touch!
likes.disliked: — No fans in the bathrooms to remove shower steam or to cover up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beer for the two free drink tickets is Bud Light. The wine was acceptable.
reviews.title: Quiet and peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Marv Herzog hotel. My husband and I go to Frankenmuth every year in October and have been awaiting the opening of this hotel. It is a small hotel with only 38 rooms and if very small without the feeling of a'small' hotel.
reviews.title: The Marv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and spacious, our room had a river veiw which I would highly recommend. We spent quite a portion of our evening on the balcony (all rooms have a balcony) and in the beer garden. Each room also has been dedicated to a portion of Marv Herzog's life with a picture telling of that era in time.
reviews.title: Beautiful View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each guest recieves two tickets for a beer/wine reception from 5-8 p.m. I was surprised to see that they had Hauf Braus--I was expecting a watered down American beer. They also had wine choices with chips and dip available for snacking. They also have 24 hour coffee.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay for Adults

likes.liked: — the size of the hotel, the decor, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast bar was wonderful, my husband and I were actually the only ones in the dining area when we ate our breakfast. They have a very nice HOT breakfast.
reviews.title: Loved the whole package!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definately be staying there from now on!
reviews.title: AWESOME, Peaceful, and friendly

likes.liked: — The comfort, the peacefulness, and the great river view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Marv Herzog. The brand new hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms are tastefully decorated and have the most comfortable beds with plenty of different types of pillows to choose from. We enjoyed our free evening wine on the terrace overlooking the Cass River. The young bartender was very friendly and was kind enough to direct us to a restaurant that did not serve chicken! Breakfast was much better than your typical hotel fare. The most remarkable thing you notice is the "new" clean smell, maybe because there is no smoking in the hotel. Would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: What a great little hotel - a real gem! It is affordable, clean and comfortable. The hotel is situated on the river, with a great patio overlooking the water. The room price includes complimentary drinks and snacks, a HOT breakfast in the morning and parking. What a steal! The town is picturesque and is one of those places that you plan to spend the day and end up staying longer. We are planning to return! Also, try the riverboat ride ($8 for a one-hour cruise) and have dinner at the Bavarian Inn.
reviews.title: Loved the Marv!

likes.liked: — The rooms were clean and beautiful. Beds were comfortable.

reviews.text: Hardly ever find nice places just off interstates. This is one. Clean, classy & friendly. That sums up the hotel-and town!! As good or better as what you see on their website. A beautiful "boutique" property set along the riverbank of a storybook town. If you like upscale accomodations at a reasonable price, you'll like this cozy hotel. It is new and seems geared toward adult travelers, which was a plus for two sisters looking for a nice peaceful place to stay, but one near some nice "non-chain" dining/cocktail establishments. There were several, and only steps from the hotel. Do not hesitate to hop off I-75 for the quick trip to unforgettable Frankenmuth. We were kind of sorry we had to move on so fast, as this is the kind of place you aren't in a hurry to leave!
reviews.title: Clean & Upscale Inn
